title: Is There A Champion That Just Screws With the Minds of Other Champions (VO Wise)?
body: So, I recently began watching the old fashion Teen Titans (not the new crap) and Slade screws with everyone. Just constantly screwing with them... is there a champion with that kind of attitude? Just screwing with everyone else to make them question themselves constantly?

replies.body:
Nocturne, possibly? Or Shaco?

Tahm Kench is also known to be quite mischievous, in a way that often costs other people either their sanity or their lives (or both).
I feel like TK just flat out insults people

While he does insult a lot of champs,he does screw with some others

For example his taunt for an ally ashe is:
"If you wanna' build an empire of peace, then your mortar will be blood."

Or his taunt for an allied draven:
"I wonder - how can you receive the attention you deserve... while your brother is in the way?"
LeBlanc or Swain would probably be closest to Slade's mentality in the current run of champions.  At least, I assume, I don't think their lores have been officially updated yet.

When Swain gets his VGU, he is going to fuck with other champions so much. Also, a Rioter once thanked me for suggesting Ed Blaylock (Fuhrer Bradley from FMA) as a potential voice actor for his new VO, so maybe we'll get him :D

> [{quoted}](name=Brutusness,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=0TpOLFa8,comment-id=00060001,timestamp=2016-10-20T17:56:31.488+0000)
>
> When Swain gets his VGU, he is going to fuck with other champions so much. Also, a Rioter once thanked me for suggesting Ed Blaylock (Fuhrer Bradley from FMA) as a potential voice actor for his new VO, so maybe we'll get him :D

Never watched FMA. But I'm tentatively interested in the Swain VGU. I absolutely love military heroes and generals. Currenrly Swain takes the narrative space of a master general but has absolutely 0 abilities that actually seem like a commander. He's just a creepy bird mage that has a VO that basically randomly shouts "Tactics!" "Flanking!" "Strategery!"

Which doesn't interest me at all. I'm also pretty sure I'm going to be disappointed when his update comes. In my head he's basically Grand Admiral Thrawn the Noxian. But I'm pretty sure once he gets reworked he'll be a bit of a commander but most of his plans will involve the weird magic stuff I just don't care about.

I think Swain will probably keep the same general feel (especially ultimate), but will be better overall. Also, Fuhrer Bradley English voice? (Spoilers below)

https://youtu.be/j-ReaqFItUc

Eh... 

https://youtu.be/6PKLlq5O3q8

Perhaps...

> [{quoted}](name=Inept Maverick,realm=NA,application-id=6kFXY1kR,discussion-id=0TpOLFa8,comment-id=0006000100000000,timestamp=2016-10-20T22:21:58.965+0000)
>
> I think Swain will probably keep the same general feel (especially ultimate), but will be better overall. Also, Fuhrer Bradley English voice? (Spoilers below)
> 
> https://youtu.be/j-ReaqFItUc
> 
> Eh... 
> 
> https://youtu.be/6PKLlq5O3q8
> 
> Perhaps...

Probably a safe bet.  Unfortunately, while generals and commanders really interest me, weird bird mage doesn't interest me at all.  I just hope they get a different commander-style champion again sometime, that isn't really just a bird mage like both Azir and Swain are, for some reason.
It's too bad their VO's are terribly outdated if that is so

That seems like it would be {{champion:7}}  bread and butter, given what we know about her. 

Additionally, given the one new scrap of characterization we got from her recent short lore story, {{champion:28}} seems like someone who'd play around with someone's head a lot too.
Xerath insults a lot and make them question their power level, same for Aurelion Sol.
Nunus counterjungling, even if you never gank you will tilt the enemy jungler so hard they'll go to lanes and feed your teammates because they have no gold or farm, or nunu bot and lulu laugh spam
lux laugh is on par with jokers imo
Taric makes me question myself about my sexuality, but aside from that, I don't know of any champion that does what you say.
